title: Trump's trade war hurting the companies and regions he intended to protect, say analysts
text:
Donald Trump's trade war is severely hurting the very companies and regions he intended to protect, new analysis by economists has revealed.

Analysts at Deutsche Bank have found that more manufacturing-intensive counties in the US are “bearing the brunt of the trade war” and seeing weakness spill over from ailing factories. These counties are suffering weaker growth and softer job markets. Manufacturing woes are spreading to services and are skewed towards Trump-voting areas, they argued.

Another report by economists Peter Egger and Jiaqing Zhu also revealed that trade war “events” are having the largest impact on US stock prices.
